an5.147:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these five gifts of an untrue person.

an5.147:1.3.pli: Asakkaccaṃ deti, acittīkatvā deti, asahatthā deti, apaviddhaṃ deti, anāgamanadiṭṭhiko deti.
an5.147:1.3.eng: They give carelessly. They give thoughtlessly. They don’t give with their own hand. They give the dregs. They give without consideration for consequences.

an5.147:1.4.eng: These are the five gifts of an untrue person.

an5.147:2.1.eng: There are these five gifts of a true person.

an5.147:2.3.pli: Sakkaccaṃ deti, cittīkatvā deti, sahatthā deti, anapaviddhaṃ deti, āgamanadiṭṭhiko deti.
an5.147:2.3.eng: They give carefully. They give thoughtfully. They give with their own hand. They don’t give the dregs. They give with consideration for consequences.

an5.147:2.4.eng: These are the five gifts of a true person.”

an5.148:1.1.eng: “There are these five gifts of a true person.

an5.148:1.3.pli: Saddhāya dānaṃ deti, sakkaccaṃ dānaṃ deti, kālena dānaṃ deti, anuggahitacitto dānaṃ deti, attānañca parañca anupahacca dānaṃ deti.
an5.148:1.3.eng: They give a gift out of faith. They give a gift carefully. They give a gift at the right time. They give a gift with no strings attached. They give a gift without damaging themselves or others.

an5.148:2.1.pli: Saddhāya kho pana, bhikkhave, dānaṃ datvā yattha yattha tassa dānassa vipāko nibbattati, aḍḍho ca hoti mahaddhano mahābhogo, abhirūpo ca hoti dassanīyo pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāya samannāgato.
an5.148:2.1.eng: Having given a gift out of faith, in whatever place the result of that gift manifests they become rich, affluent, and wealthy. And they’re attractive, good-looking, lovely, of surpassing beauty.

an5.148:3.1.pli: Sakkaccaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, dānaṃ datvā yattha yattha tassa dānassa vipāko nibbattati, aḍḍho ca hoti mahaddhano mahābhogo.
an5.148:3.1.eng: Having given a gift carefully, in whatever place the result of that gift manifests they become rich, affluent, and wealthy.

an5.148:3.2.pli: Yepissa te honti puttāti vā dārāti vā dāsāti vā pessāti vā kammakarāti vā, tepi sussūsanti sotaṃ odahanti aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapenti.
an5.148:3.2.eng: And their children, wives, bondservants, servants, and workers want to listen. They actively listen and try to understand.

an5.148:4.1.pli: Kālena kho pana, bhikkhave, dānaṃ datvā yattha yattha tassa dānassa vipāko nibbattati, aḍḍho ca hoti mahaddhano mahābhogo;
an5.148:4.1.eng: Having given a gift at the right time, in whatever place the result of that gift manifests they become rich, affluent, and wealthy.

an5.148:4.2.eng: And when the time is right, their needs are amply satisfied.

an5.148:5.1.pli: Anuggahitacitto kho pana, bhikkhave, dānaṃ datvā yattha yattha tassa dānassa vipāko nibbattati, aḍḍho ca hoti mahaddhano mahābhogo;
an5.148:5.1.eng: Having given a gift with no strings attached, in whatever place the result of that gift manifests they become rich, affluent, and wealthy.

an5.148:5.2.pli: uḷāresu ca pañcasu kāmaguṇesu bhogāya cittaṃ namati.
an5.148:5.2.eng: And their mind tends to enjoy the five refined kinds of sensual stimulation.

an5.148:6.1.pli: Attānañca parañca anupahacca kho pana, bhikkhave, dānaṃ datvā yattha yattha tassa dānassa vipāko nibbattati, aḍḍho ca hoti mahaddhano mahābhogo;
an5.148:6.1.eng: Having given a gift without damaging themselves or others, in whatever place the result of that gift manifests they become rich, affluent, and wealthy.

an5.148:6.2.pli: na cassa kutoci bhogānaṃ upaghāto āgacchati aggito vā udakato vā rājato vā corato vā appiyato vā dāyādato.
an5.148:6.2.eng: And no damage comes to their property from anywhere, whether fire, flood, rulers, bandits, or unloved heirs.

an5.148:6.3.eng: These are the five gifts of a true person.”

an5.149:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā samayavimuttassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.149:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.

an5.149:1.3.pli: Kammārāmatā, bhassārāmatā, niddārāmatā, saṅgaṇikārāmatā, yathāvimuttaṃ cittaṃ na paccavekkhati.
an5.149:1.3.eng: They relish work, talk, sleep, and company. And they don’t review the extent of their mind’s freedom.

an5.149:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā samayavimuttassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.149:1.4.eng: These five things lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.

an5.149:2.1.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā samayavimuttassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.149:2.1.eng: These five things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.

an5.149:2.3.pli: Na kammārāmatā, na bhassārāmatā, na niddārāmatā, na saṅgaṇikārāmatā, yathāvimuttaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhati.
an5.149:2.3.eng: They don’t relish work, talk, sleep, and company. And they review the extent of their mind’s freedom.

an5.149:2.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā samayavimuttassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
an5.149:2.4.eng: These five things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.”

an5.15:1.3.eng: The powers of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

an5.15:1.4.eng: And where should the power of faith be seen?

an5.15:1.5.eng: In the four factors of stream-entry.

an5.15:1.7.eng: And where should the power of energy be seen?

an5.15:1.10.eng: And where should the power of mindfulness be seen?

an5.15:1.11.eng: In the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

an5.15:1.13.eng: And where should the power of immersion be seen?

an5.15:1.16.eng: And where should the power of wisdom be seen?

an5.150:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā samayavimuttassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.150:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.

an5.150:1.3.pli: Kammārāmatā, bhassārāmatā, niddārāmatā, indriyesu aguttadvāratā, bhojane amattaññutā.
an5.150:1.3.eng: They relish work, talk, and sleep. They don’t guard the sense doors and they eat too much.

an5.150:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā samayavimuttassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.150:1.4.eng: These five things lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.

an5.150:2.1.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā samayavimuttassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.150:2.1.eng: These five things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.

an5.150:2.3.pli: Na kammārāmatā, na bhassārāmatā, na niddārāmatā, indriyesu guttadvāratā, bhojane mattaññutā.
an5.150:2.3.eng: They don’t relish work, talk, and sleep. They guard the sense doors and they have moderation in eating.

an5.150:2.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā samayavimuttassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
an5.150:2.4.eng: These five things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.”

an5.151:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an5.151:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities is unable to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.

an5.151:1.3.pli: Kathaṃ paribhoti, kathikaṃ paribhoti, attānaṃ paribhoti, vikkhittacitto dhammaṃ suṇāti, anekaggacitto ayoniso ca manasi karoti.
an5.151:1.3.eng: They disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They listen with scattered and disunified mind. They apply the mind irrationally.

an5.151:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an5.151:1.4.eng: Someone with these five qualities is unable to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, even when listening to the true teaching.

an5.151:2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an5.151:2.1.eng: Someone with five qualities is able to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.

an5.151:2.3.pli: Na kathaṃ paribhoti, na kathikaṃ paribhoti, na attānaṃ paribhoti, avikkhittacitto dhammaṃ suṇāti, ekaggacitto yoniso ca manasi karoti.
an5.151:2.3.eng: They don’t disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They listen with unscattered and unified mind. They apply the mind rationally.

an5.151:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattan”ti.
an5.151:2.4.eng: Someone with these five qualities is able to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”

an5.152:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an5.152:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities is unable to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.

an5.152:1.3.pli: Kathaṃ paribhoti, kathikaṃ paribhoti, attānaṃ paribhoti, duppañño hoti jaḷo eḷamūgo, anaññāte aññātamānī hoti.
an5.152:1.3.eng: They disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They’re witless, dull, and idiotic. They think they know what they don’t know.

an5.152:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an5.152:1.4.eng: Someone with these five qualities is unable to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, even when listening to the true teaching.

an5.152:2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an5.152:2.1.eng: Someone with five qualities is able to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.

an5.152:2.3.pli: Na kathaṃ paribhoti, na kathikaṃ paribhoti, na attānaṃ paribhoti, paññavā hoti ajaḷo aneḷamūgo, na anaññāte aññātamānī hoti.
an5.152:2.3.eng: They don’t disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They’re wise, bright, and clever. They don’t think they know what they don’t know.

an5.152:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattan”ti.
an5.152:2.4.eng: Someone with these five qualities is able to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”

an5.153:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an5.153:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities is unable to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.

an5.153:1.3.pli: Makkhī dhammaṃ suṇāti makkhapariyuṭṭhito, upārambhacitto dhammaṃ suṇāti randhagavesī, dhammadesake āhatacitto hoti khīlajāto, duppañño hoti jaḷo eḷamūgo, anaññāte aññātamānī hoti.
an5.153:1.3.eng: They listen to the teaching bent only on putting it down. They listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind. They’re antagonistic to the teacher, planning to attack them. They’re witless, dull, and idiotic. And they think they know what they don’t know.

an5.153:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an5.153:1.4.eng: Someone with these five qualities is unable to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.

an5.153:2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an5.153:2.1.eng: Someone with five qualities is able to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.

an5.153:2.3.pli: Amakkhī dhammaṃ suṇāti na makkhapariyuṭṭhito, anupārambhacitto dhammaṃ suṇāti na randhagavesī, dhammadesake anāhatacitto hoti akhīlajāto, paññavā hoti ajaḷo aneḷamūgo, na anaññāte aññātamānī hoti.
an5.153:2.3.eng: They don’t listen to the teaching bent only on putting it down. They don’t listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind. They’re not antagonistic to the teacher, and not planning to attack them. They’re wise, bright, and clever. And they don’t think they know what they don’t know.

an5.153:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattan”ti.
an5.153:2.4.eng: Someone with these five qualities is able to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”

an5.154:0.3.eng: The Decline of the True Teaching (1st)

an5.154:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.154:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.154:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ suṇanti, na sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti, na sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ dhārenti, na sakkaccaṃ dhātānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhanti, na sakkaccaṃ atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammaṃ paṭipajjanti.
an5.154:1.3.eng: It’s when mendicants don’t carefully listen to the teachings, memorize them, and remember them. They don’t carefully examine the meaning of teachings that they remember. And they don’t carefully practice in line with the meaning and the teaching they’ve understood.

an5.154:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.154:1.4.eng: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.154:2.1.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.154:2.1.eng: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

an5.154:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ suṇanti, sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti, sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ dhārenti, sakkaccaṃ dhātānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhanti, sakkaccaṃ atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammaṃ paṭipajjanti.
an5.154:2.3.eng: It’s when mendicants carefully listen to the teachings, memorize them, and remember them. They carefully examine the meaning of teachings that they remember. And they carefully practice in line with the meaning and the teaching they’ve understood.

an5.154:2.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
an5.154:2.4.eng: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”

an5.155:0.3.eng: The Decline of the True Teaching (2nd)

an5.155:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.155:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.155:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū dhammaṃ na pariyāpuṇanti—
an5.155:1.3.eng: It’s when the mendicants don’t memorize the teaching—

an5.155:1.4.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
an5.155:1.4.eng: statements, mixed prose & verse, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and elaborations.

an5.155:1.5.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
an5.155:1.5.eng: This is the first thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.155:2.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ na vitthārena paresaṃ desenti.
an5.155:2.1.eng: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t explain the teaching in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.

an5.155:2.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.

an5.155:3.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ na vitthārena paraṃ vācenti.
an5.155:3.1.eng: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t make others recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.

an5.155:3.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.

an5.155:4.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ na vitthārena sajjhāyaṃ karonti.
an5.155:4.1.eng: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t rehearse the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.

an5.155:4.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.

an5.155:5.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ na cetasā anuvitakkenti anuvicārenti manasānupekkhanti.
an5.155:5.1.eng: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t think about and consider the teaching in their hearts, examining it with their minds as they learned and memorized it.

an5.155:5.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
an5.155:5.2.eng: This is the fifth thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.155:5.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.155:5.3.eng: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.155:6.1.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.155:6.1.eng: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

an5.155:6.3.eng: It’s when the mendicants memorize the teaching—

an5.155:6.4.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
an5.155:6.4.eng: statements, mixed prose & verse, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and elaborations.

an5.155:6.5.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
an5.155:6.5.eng: This is the first thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

an5.155:7.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ vitthārena paresaṃ desenti.
an5.155:7.1.eng: Furthermore, the mendicants explain the teaching in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.

an5.155:7.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.

an5.155:8.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ vitthārena paraṃ vācenti.
an5.155:8.1.eng: Furthermore, the mendicants make others recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.

an5.155:8.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.

an5.155:9.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ vitthārena sajjhāyaṃ karonti.
an5.155:9.1.eng: Furthermore, the mendicants rehearse the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.

an5.155:9.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.

an5.155:10.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ cetasā anuvitakkenti anuvicārenti manasānupekkhanti.
an5.155:10.1.eng: Furthermore, the mendicants think about and consider the teaching in their hearts, examining it with their minds as they learned and memorized it.

an5.155:10.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
an5.155:10.2.eng: This is the fifth thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

an5.155:10.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
an5.155:10.3.eng: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”

an5.156:0.3.eng: The Decline of the True Teaching (3rd)

an5.156:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.156:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.156:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū duggahitaṃ suttantaṃ pariyāpuṇanti dunnikkhittehi padabyañjanehi.
an5.156:1.3.eng: It’s when the mendicants memorize discourses that they learned incorrectly, with misplaced words and phrases.

an5.156:1.4.pli: Dunnikkhittassa, bhikkhave, padabyañjanassa atthopi dunnayo hoti.
an5.156:1.4.eng: When the words and phrases are misplaced, the meaning is misinterpreted.

an5.156:1.5.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
an5.156:1.5.eng: This is the first thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.156:2.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū dubbacā honti, dovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgatā, akkhamā appadakkhiṇaggāhino anusāsaniṃ.
an5.156:2.1.eng: Furthermore, the mendicants are hard to admonish, having qualities that make them hard to admonish. They’re impatient, and don’t take instruction respectfully.

an5.156:2.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.

an5.156:3.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ye te bhikkhū bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā, te na sakkaccaṃ suttantaṃ paraṃ vācenti;
an5.156:3.1.eng: Furthermore, the mendicants who are very learned—inheritors of the heritage, who have memorized the teachings, the monastic law, and the outlines—don’t carefully make others recite the discourses.

an5.156:3.2.pli: tesaṃ accayena chinnamūlako suttanto hoti appaṭisaraṇo.
an5.156:3.2.eng: When they pass away, the discourses are cut off at the root, with no-one to preserve them.

an5.156:3.3.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.

an5.156:4.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, therā bhikkhū bāhulikā honti sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhittadhurā, na vīriyaṃ ārabhanti appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
an5.156:4.1.eng: Furthermore, the senior mendicants are indulgent and slack, leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion, not rousing energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.

an5.156:4.2.eng: Those who come after them follow their example.

an5.156:4.3.pli: Sāpi hoti bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhittadhurā, na vīriyaṃ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
an5.156:4.3.eng: They too are indulgent and slack …

an5.156:4.4.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.

an5.156:5.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, saṅgho bhinno hoti.
an5.156:5.1.eng: Furthermore, there’s a schism in the Saṅgha.

an5.156:5.2.pli: Saṅghe kho pana, bhikkhave, bhinne aññamaññaṃ akkosā ca honti, aññamaññaṃ paribhāsā ca honti, aññamaññaṃ parikkhepā ca honti, aññamaññaṃ pariccajanā ca honti.
an5.156:5.2.eng: When the Saṅgha is split, they abuse, insult, block, and forsake each other.

an5.156:5.3.pli: Tattha appasannā ceva nappasīdanti, pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattaṃ hoti.
an5.156:5.3.eng: This doesn’t inspire confidence in those without it, and it causes some with confidence to change their minds.

an5.156:5.4.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
an5.156:5.4.eng: This is the fifth thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.156:5.5.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.156:5.5.eng: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.156:6.1.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
an5.156:6.1.eng: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

an5.156:6.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū suggahitaṃ suttantaṃ pariyāpuṇanti sunikkhittehi padabyañjanehi.
an5.156:6.3.eng: It’s when the mendicants memorize discourses that have been learned correctly, with well placed words and phrases.

an5.156:6.4.pli: Sunikkhittassa, bhikkhave, padabyañjanassa atthopi sunayo hoti.
an5.156:6.4.eng: When the words and phrases are well organized, the meaning is correctly interpreted.

an5.156:6.5.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
an5.156:6.5.eng: This is the first thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

an5.156:7.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū suvacā honti sovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgatā, khamā padakkhiṇaggāhino anusāsaniṃ.
an5.156:7.1.eng: Furthermore, the mendicants are easy to admonish, having qualities that make them easy to admonish. They’re patient, and take instruction respectfully.

an5.156:7.2.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.

an5.156:8.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ye te bhikkhū bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā, te sakkaccaṃ suttantaṃ paraṃ vācenti;
an5.156:8.1.eng: Furthermore, the mendicants who are very learned—inheritors of the heritage, who have memorized the teachings, the monastic law, and the outlines—carefully make others recite the discourses.

an5.156:8.2.pli: tesaṃ accayena na chinnamūlako suttanto hoti sappaṭisaraṇo.
an5.156:8.2.eng: When they pass away, the discourses aren’t cut off at the root, and they have someone to preserve them.

an5.156:8.3.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.

an5.156:9.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, therā bhikkhū na bāhulikā honti na sāthalikā, okkamane nikkhittadhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamā; vīriyaṃ ārabhanti appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
an5.156:9.1.eng: Furthermore, the senior mendicants are not indulgent and slack, leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion. They rouse energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.

an5.156:9.2.eng: Those who come after them follow their example.

an5.156:9.3.pli: Sāpi hoti na bāhulikā na sāthalikā, okkamane nikkhittadhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamā, vīriyaṃ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
an5.156:9.3.eng: They too are not indulgent or slack …

an5.156:9.4.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.

an5.156:10.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, saṅgho samaggo sammodamāno avivadamāno ekuddeso phāsuṃ viharati.
an5.156:10.1.eng: Furthermore, the Saṅgha lives comfortably, in harmony, appreciating each other, without dispute, with one recitation.

an5.156:10.2.pli: Saṅghe kho pana, bhikkhave, samagge na ceva aññamaññaṃ akkosā honti, na ca aññamaññaṃ paribhāsā honti, na ca aññamaññaṃ parikkhepā honti, na ca aññamaññaṃ pariccajanā honti.
an5.156:10.2.eng: When the Saṅgha is in harmony, they don’t abuse, insult, block, or forsake each other.

an5.156:10.3.pli: Tattha appasannā ceva pasīdanti, pasannānañca bhiyyobhāvo hoti.
an5.156:10.3.eng: This inspires confidence in those without it, and increases confidence in those who have it.

an5.156:10.4.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
an5.156:10.4.eng: This is the fifth thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

an5.156:10.5.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
an5.156:10.5.eng: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”
